Package utilities

Class ConfigurablePID

java.lang.Object
utilities.ConfigurablePID
public class ConfigurablePID extends Object
A PID controller with settings for ranges on all values, and a velocity based control mode.
Author:
Icarus Innovated

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ConfigurablePID()
    Creates a new Configurable PID with default parameters
    ConfigurablePID(double proportionalGain, double integralGain, double derivativeGain)
    Creates a new configurable PID controller with the set gains.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigurablePID

      public ConfigurablePID()
      Creates a new Configurable PID with default parameters

    • ConfigurablePID

      public ConfigurablePID(double proportionalGain, double integralGain, double derivativeGain)
      Creates a new configurable PID controller with the set gains.
      Parameters:
      proportionalGain - scales the proportional of the error
      integralGain - scales the integral of the error
      derivativeGain - scales the derivative of the error

  • Method Details

    • runPID

      public double runPID(double setpoint, double processVariable)
      Computes a new output based on the set point and process variable. If a speed has been set, the output will be based on speed.
      Parameters:
      setpoint - The value that the system should try match the process variable to.
      processVariable - The measured value from the system that is being controlled.
      Returns:
      The computed output to correct the process variable to the setpoint.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(double newSpeed)
      Set the speed used in runPID(). Once speed has been set to a non-zero number, the controller will use velocity in its calculations.
      Parameters:
      newSpeed - The speed to use in runPID(). This is in units per program run.

    • setMinOutput

      public void setMinOutput(double newMinOutput)
      Set the minimum allowed output for the controller.
      Parameters:
      newMinOutput - The minimum output of the controller

    • setMaxOutput

      public void setMaxOutput(double newMaxOutput)
      Set the maximum allowed output for the controller.
      Parameters:
      newMaxOutput - the maximum output of the controller

    • setOutputRange

      public void setOutputRange(double newMinOutput, double newMaxOutput)
      Set the allowed range of the output of the controller.
      Parameters:
      newMinOutput - the minimum output
      newMaxOutput - the maximum output

    • setMinProportional

      public void setMinProportional(double newMinProportional)
      Set the minimum allowed proportional component for the controller.
      Parameters:
      newMinProportional - the minimum proportional component

    • setMaxProportional

      newMaxProportional - the maximum proportional component

    • getError

      public double getError()
      Get the last computed error value
      Returns:
      last computed error

    • setErrorTolerance

      public void setErrorTolerance(double newErrorTolerance)
      Set the allowed error of the controller.
      Parameters:
      newErrorTolerance - When the absolute value of the error is less than this number, the controller will output 0 and reset.

    • resetValues

      public void resetValues()
      Reset values to 0. This function should be called whenever the controller stops running. This function will be called automatically when running the controller if a tolerance has been configured.
